intro: Henriettea martiusii var. orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco Henriettea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Orinoco River basin in South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are simple and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a dark green color. Henriettea martiusii var. orinocensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology.
